From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To specify the text of a menu item in a user menu, use the **menu text**command in global configuration mode.

ParaDef.Info: Name of the menu. You can specify a maximum of 20 characters.

Number, character, or string used as the key for the item. The key is displayed to the left of the menu item text. You can specify a maximum of 18 menu items. When the tenth item is added to the menu, the **menu line-mode** and **menu single-space** commands are activated automatically.

Examples: In the following example, the descriptive text for the three entries is specified for options 1, 2, and 3 in the menu named Access1:
menu Access1 text 1 IBM Information Systems
menu Access1 text 2 UNIX Internet Access
menu Access1 text 3 Exit menu system
ExtraInfo: Use this command to assign text to items in a menu. Use the **menu command** command to assign actions to items. These commands must use the same menu name and menu selection key.You can specify a maximum of 18 items in a menu.
